title: Ajinkya Ranade
text:
Hello! My name is Ajinkya Ranade. I currently work as JSPS postdoctoral fellow at Institute of Science Tokyo, Japan. My research focuses on innovating efficient, sustainable and fit-for-purpose water treatment technologies for water recycling and energy conservation.
An analytical chemist with interdisciplinary research experience in graphene technology, optoelectronics, and wastewater treatment exploring opportunities to innovate sustainable treatment technologies in the research and development sector. I aim to utilize my interdisciplinary background for innovation in clean energy and tackling the water-energy nexus to achieve a sustainable future. Currently looking for organizations that provides me ample scope to nurture this interest and develop my skills.

Expertise in individual (adsorption, photocatalysis, biodegradation ) and synergic (intimately coupled photocatalytic biodegradation) wastewater treatment technologies with a critical focus on sustainability
Expertise in materials engineering, graphene technology, semiconductor technology and optoelectronics
Expertise in fabrication of high-quality monolayer graphene using (atmospheric and low pressure) chemical vapor deposition techniques
Published three first author publication and 9 co-author publications
Recent publication in the prestigious Water Research Journal

title: Publications
text:
Ajinkya Kishor Ranade*, Akira Yamaguchi, Masahiro Miyauchi, Sreenivasan Ramaswami, Chihiro Yoshimura, “Interface dependent electron shunting in graphene-integrated intimately coupled photocatalytic biodegradation”, Water Research, Volume 273,123064, 2025. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.watres.2024.123064 .
Ajinkya K. Ranade, Rakesh D. Mahyavanshi, Pradeep Desai, Masashi Kato, Masaki Tanemura, Golap Kalita, “Ultraviolet light induced electrical hysteresis effect in graphene-GaN heterojunction”, Applied Physics Letters, 114, 151102, 2019. DOI: 10.1063/1.5084190.

(Above article was highlighted in renowned scientific websites i.e. www.graphene-info.com and www.nanowerk.com which report on significant advancement in graphene technology and nanotechnology respectively.)

title: Awards
text:
JSPS postdoctoral fellowship (2023-2025): School of Environment and Society, Tokyo Institute of Technology, Japan. ( Research grant – 2 million JPY)

Project Title: Graphene-induced charge separation for enhancing intimately coupled photocatalytic biodegradation.

IISc-IOE postdoctoral fellowship (2022-2023): Institute of Eminence postdoctoral fellowship. Indian Institute of Science, Bengaluru, India.

Project Title: Multifunctional biocarrier-based intimately coupled photocatalytic biodegradation (ICPB) for enhanced degradation of organic micropollutants.

title: Publications
text:
Paper presentations at Conference / Symposium

“Interface-engineered electron shuttling in graphene-based intimately coupled photocatalytic biodegradation for enhanced antibiotic degradation”, Ajinkya K. Ranade, Akira Yamaguchi, Sreenivasan Ramaswami, Masahiro Miyauchi, Chihiro Yoshimura, The 8th Symposium on Environmental Water Quality Engineering, Yamanashi University, Japan. (1 st June 2024)
“Schottky Junction Properties of Graphene with Nitrogen and Gallium Polar Freestanding GaN”, The 19th IEEE International Conference on Nanotechnology, Macau SAR, China, July 22-26 2019, Ajinkya K. Ranade, Rakesh Mahyavanshi, Pradeep Desai, Masaki Tanemura, Golap Kalita.
“Ultraviolet Light Induced Electrical Hysteresis Effect in Graphene-GaN Heterojunction”, The 66th JSAP Spring Meeting 2019, Tokyo, Ajinkya K. Ranade, Rakesh Mahyavanshi, Pradeep Desai, Masaki Tanemura, Golap Kalita.
“Temperature dependent ultraviolet photoresponsive behaviour in γ-CuI/GaN heterojunction”, The 80th JSAP Autumn Meeting 2019, Hokkaido, Japan, Ajinkya K. Ranade, Pradeep Desai, Rakesh Mahyavanshi, Masaki Tanemura, Golap Kalita.
“Interface dependent photoresponsivity in graphene GaN heterojunction”, 57th Fullerenes- Nanotube-graphene symposium, Nagoya, Japan, Ajinkya K. Ranade, Pradeep Desai, Rakesh Mahyavanshi, Masaki Tanemura, Golap Kalita.
“Understanding photocarrier dynamics of graphene/GaN heterojunction”, Ajinkya K. Ranade, Rakesh Mahyavanshi, Pradeep Desai, Masaki Tanemura, Golap Kalita, FRIMS Symposium, Nagoya Institute of Technology, Nagoya, Japan. (November -2018).
